channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: AI is booming—and the bust could be even bigger
item.description: In the 1960s, IBM embarked on what Fortune called the $5 billion gamble . It was a bet-the-company investment on a scale nobody had seen before. The p...

item.title: Wall Street thinks China is winning Trump’s trade war
item.description: China holds an unexpectedly strong hand in the trade war, and the U.S.’s tariffs have been counterintuitively positive for China.

item.title: Innovation hubs are struggling. Here’s what’s next
item.description: Innovation hubs were once the darlings of corporate strategy, promising to future-proof businesses and spark breakthrough ideas. But two decades in, t...

item.title: Is a Dumber Smartphone the Answer? Why People Are Embracing the Luddite Life
item.description: From corded phones to dumbed down mobile devices, there’s growing demand for gadgets that help reduce screen time.

item.title: How PepsiCo Is Riding the Ozempic Wave With Protein Drinks
item.description: The company’s new Propel Clear Protein caters to consumers on weight-loss drugs who need more protein, fiber, and hydration.

item.title: The immigration crackdown is ‘much, much worse’ for business than tariffs, some CEOs say
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: The ‘Blue Dolphin’ Rule: Stop negative thoughts with emotional intelligence
item.description: Ever had a song you couldn’t get out of your head? That happened to me the other day. Pink Pony Club. It’s everywhere right now; I can’t escape it. An...

item.title: A Massive New Study of 40,725 People Says This Is What Happens When You Drink Coffee Every Morning

item.title: What’s open and closed on Columbus Day 2025? Holiday info for stores, banks, post offices, stock markets, pharmacies
item.description: This year, Columbus Day, also known as Indigenous Peoples’ Day, lands on Monday, October 13. While it’s a federal holiday and many schools have it off...

item.title: History Says the Stock Market Has Room to Go Much Higher
item.description: The bull market turns three years old with an 83 percent gain.

item.title: Which Is ‘Better’? 4 Things Science Says Most People Don’t Understand About Introverts and Extroverts
item.description: Think extroverts are better leaders? Better at sales? Think introverts spend more time alone, thinking? Think again.

item.title: This charming animation is a love letter to New York City’s subway
item.description: When we consider the subway, it’s often for reasons that have to do with decay and deterioration. The switches are outdated. The elevators are broken....

item.title: Stocks face earnings test with S&P 500 already shaken by shutdown
‘We will have a crash’: Why Andrew Ross Sorkin thinks bubble will eventually pop
Vance warns the longer the shutdown goes on, ‘the deeper the cuts are going to be’ as White House prepares to fire over 4,000 workers
item.description: “To be clear, some of these cuts are going to be painful. This is not a situation that we relish."

item.title: Trump warns Russia he may send Tomahawk missiles to Ukraine if war isn’t settled soon in ‘a new step of aggression’
item.description: “Do they want to have Tomahawks going in that direction? I don’t think so,” Trump said of Russia. “I think I might speak to Russia about that.”
